com.samskivert.swing.util
Class MenuUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.swing.util.MenuUtil

public class MenuUtil
extends Object

The menu util class provides miscellaneous useful utility routines for working with menus. Adding a menu item with both a mnemonic and an accelerator to a menu in a frame that listens to its own menus (a common case) can be simplified like so: 

 accel = KeyStroke.getKeyStroke(KeyEvent.VK_N, ActionEvent.ALT_MASK);
 MenuUtil.addMenuItem(this, menuFile, "New", KeyEvent.VK_N, acc);

addMenuItem

public static JMenuItem addMenuItem(ActionListener l,
                                    JMenu menu,
                                    String name,
                                    Integer mnem,
                                    KeyStroke accel)
Adds a new menu item to the menu with the specified name and attributes.

Parameters:
l - the action listener.
menu - the menu to add the item to.
name - the item name.
mnem - the mnemonic key for the item or null if none.
accel - the keystroke for the item or null if none.
Returns:
the new menu item.

addMenuItem

public static JMenuItem addMenuItem(JMenu menu,
                                    String name,
                                    int mnem,
                                    KeyStroke accel,
                                    Object target,
                                    String callbackName)
Adds a new menu item to the menu with the specified name and attributes. The supplied method name will be called (it must have the same signature as ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) but can be named whatever you like) when the menu item is selected.

Parameters:
menu - the menu to add the item to.
name - the item name.
mnem - the mnemonic key for the item.
accel - the keystroke for the item or null if none.
target - the object on which to invoke a method when the menu is selected.
callbackName - the name of the method to invoke when the menu is selected.
Returns:
the new menu item.

addMenuItem

public static JMenuItem addMenuItem(JMenu menu,
                                    String name,
                                    Object target,
                                    String callbackName)
Adds a new menu item to the menu with the specified name and attributes. The supplied method name will be called (it must have the same signature as ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) but can be named whatever you like) when the menu item is selected.

Parameters:
menu - the menu to add the item to.
name - the item name.
target - the object on which to invoke a method when the menu is selected.
callbackName - the name of the method to invoke when the menu is selected.
Returns:
the new menu item.

addMenuItem

public static JMenuItem addMenuItem(JPopupMenu menu,
                                    String name,
                                    Object target,
                                    String callbackName)
Adds a new menu item to the popup menu with the specified name and attributes. The supplied method name will be called (it must have the same signature as ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) but can be named whatever you like) when the menu item is selected.

Note that this JPopupMenu-specific implementation exists solely because JPopupMenu doesn't extend JMenu and so we have to explicitly call JPopupMenu.add(javax.swing.JMenuItem) rather than JMenu.add(javax.swing.JMenuItem).

Parameters:
menu - the menu to add the item to.
name - the item name.
target - the object on which to invoke a method when the menu is selected.
callbackName - the name of the method to invoke when the menu is selected.
Returns:
the new menu item.
